architectureStyle.description: Organic, purple, theocratic - designed to honor the Founders and control subjects
keyElements: ORGANIC curves and shapes - like giant insects or sea creatures
PURPLE and VIOLET as primary colors - the Founders' aesthetic
Bioluminescent lighting - glowing panels, no harsh artificial light
Founder worship shrines and imagery throughout
NO sharp angles - everything flows and curves
Structures seem grown rather than built
Central pools for Founders to rest in liquid form
architectureStyle.colors: Purple, violet, lavender, with bioluminescent blue-purple accents
architectureStyle.materials: Bio-organic materials, living structural elements, membrane walls

buildings.name: Great Link Chamber
buildings.description: Sacred space where Founders join the Great Link - pool of changeling matter with cathedral reverence

buildings.name: Dominion Command
buildings.description: Military headquarters where Vorta commanders and Jem'Hadar Firsts coordinate operations

buildings.name: Vorta Administrative Center
buildings.description: Where Vorta administrators manage Dominion affairs - comfortable and organized

buildings.name: Occupation Headquarters
buildings.description: Controls subjugated worlds with Vorta Overseer's office and Jem'Hadar garrison

buildings.name: Founder Residence
buildings.description: Private quarters for Founders with pool chambers and morphogenic fields

buildings.name: Founder Temple
buildings.description: Place where Vorta and Jem'Hadar worship their living gods with Founder statues

buildings.name: Victory Monument
buildings.description: Celebrates Dominion conquests with inscribed names of subjugated worlds

buildings.name: Weyoun Memorial
buildings.description: Honors fallen Vorta administrators where new clones absorb memories

buildings.name: Propaganda Bureau
buildings.description: Spreads the message of Founder benevolence - resistance is both futile and sinful

buildings.name: Ketracel-White Facility
buildings.description: Produces the drug Jem'Hadar need to survive - most critical facility

buildings.name: Cloning Facility
buildings.description: Where Vorta are cloned and Jem'Hadar are bred in rows of maturation chambers

buildings.name: Shipyard Control
buildings.description: Oversees construction of Jem'Hadar ships in organic-looking facility

buildings.name: Resource Extraction
buildings.description: Harvests materials from conquered worlds, uncaring of environmental damage

buildings.name: Genetic Engineering Lab
buildings.description: Creates and modifies species to serve the Founders - Jem'Hadar enhancement, Vorta programming

buildings.name: Medical Research
buildings.description: Studies diseases both to cure Founders and to weaponize against solids

buildings.name: Species Processing
buildings.description: Evaluates conquered species for usefulness - some serve, others are eliminated

buildings.name: Jem'Hadar Barracks
buildings.description: Spartan housing for soldiers with white dispensers and weapons storage

buildings.name: Training Facility
buildings.description: Where Jem'Hadar learn tactics - they emerge able to fight, but strategy is trained

buildings.name: Defense Battery
buildings.description: Polaron beam weapons and torpedo launchers - organic-looking but deadly

buildings.name: Punishment Chamber
buildings.description: Where those who defy the Founders are dealt with - Jem'Hadar don't need prisons

buildings.name: Surveillance Center
buildings.description: Monitors subject populations - the Founders see all, know all

buildings.name: Energy Generation
buildings.description: Power plant with organic aesthetic providing energy for all facilities

buildings.name: Communications Relay
buildings.description: Long-range subspace communication shaped like organic tower

buildings.name: Diplomatic Mission
buildings.description: Embassy where Vorta diplomats excel at manipulation and false promises
